Interface Cell

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCell, GooseCell, NormalCell, TeleportCell, TrapCell, WaitCell

    public interface Cell

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canBeLeftNow()
      Indicates if the player occupying this cell, can leave the cell or not
      int getIndex()
      Indicates the position of this cell on the board
      Player getPlayer()
      Returns the player currently on the cell (null if there are no players)
      int handleMove(int diceThrow)
      Returns the cell really reached by a player when he arrives on this cell
      boolean isBusy()
      Indicates if a player is already on the cell
      boolean isRetaining()
      Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell
      void welcome(Player player)
      Remembers player to be on this cell.

    • Method Detail

      • canBeLeftNow

        boolean canBeLeftNow()
        Indicates if the player occupying this cell, can leave the cell or not
        Returns:
        true if the player can leave the cell, false if not

      • isRetaining

        boolean isRetaining()
        Indicates if a cell holds a player until another player reaches the same cell
        Returns:
        true if the only way for a player to get out of this cell is for another player to replace him

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Indicates the position of this cell on the board
        Returns:
        the position of the cell

      • handleMove

        int handleMove(int diceThrow)
        Returns the cell really reached by a player when he arrives on this cell
        Parameters:
        diceThrow - the result of the dice when the player reaches this cell
        Returns:
        the index of the cell really reached by the player

      • isBusy

        boolean isBusy()
        Indicates if a player is already on the cell
        Returns:
        true if the cell is already occupied

      • getPlayer

        Player getPlayer()
        Returns the player currently on the cell (null if there are no players)
        Returns:
        the player currently on the cell

      • welcome

        void welcome(Player player)
        Remembers player to be on this cell.
        Parameters:
        player - the player who reached the cell.
